content.text:
# Suno AI Prompt Generator

Analyzes songs and generates optimized prompts for Suno AI music generation. Creates both style and lyrics prompts that capture the essence of a song.

## Prerequisites

The command requires `yt-dlp` to be installed for YouTube URLs:

```bash
# macOS
brew install yt-dlp

# Linux
pip3 install yt-dlp
```

## Instructions

### Command Format

```bash
/suno <youtube-url|file-path> [topic]
```

**Parameters:**
- `youtube-url|file-path`: YouTube URL or path to audio file (required)
- `topic`: What the new song should be about (optional, defaults to "similar theme")

### What This Command Does

The `/suno` command generates TWO optimized prompts for Suno AI:

#### 1. Style Prompt (<1000 characters)
- Musical attributes (BPM, key, genre)
- Instrumentation details
- Beat/rhythm description
- Mood and atmosphere
- Section-by-section breakdown (intro, verse, chorus, etc.)

#### 2. Lyrics Prompt (<5000 characters)
- Original lyrics inspired by the source
- Matches the vibe and essence
- Follows same structure (verse/chorus/bridge)
- Uses similar rhyme schemes and patterns
- Based on your specified topic

### Examples

**Example 1: Analyze a YouTube video**
```bash
/suno https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RjKKOqHyD34
```

**Example 2: Custom topic**
```bash
/suno https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RjKKOqHyD34 "a song about chasing dreams"
```

**Example 3: Local audio file**
```bash
/suno ~/Music/my-song.mp3 "a song about heartbreak"
```

## Implementation Steps

When this command is invoked:

1. **Execute the skill script**
   ```bash
   ~/.claude/skills/suno.sh "$1" "$2"
   ```
   This will output the analysis instructions.

2. **Research Song Details**
   - Search for: "[Song Title] [Artist] BPM key genre"
   - Look for music databases (MusicStax, Tunebat, Song BPM, etc.)
   - Find: BPM, Key, Genre, Mood

3. **Analyze Instrumentation**
   - Search for: "[Song Title] instrumental breakdown" or "production analysis"
   - Identify: bass style, drums/percussion, melodic elements
   - Note: texture and layering

4. **Get Original Lyrics**
   - Search for: "[Song Title] [Artist] lyrics"
   - Analyze structure: verse/chorus/bridge layout
   - Note: rhyme schemes, line patterns

5. **Extract Vibe/Essence**
   - Theme: What is the song about?
   - Tone: Emotional quality
   - Imagery: Visual/sensory language
   - Voice: Perspective (first person, storytelling, etc.)

6. **Generate New Lyrics**
   - DO NOT copy original lyrics
   - CAPTURE the vibe, tone, and emotional essence
   - MATCH the structure (verse/chorus/bridge layout)
   - USE similar rhyme schemes and line patterns
   - KEEP total under 5000 characters

7. **Create Style Prompt**
   Format:
   ```
   A [mood] [genre] song at [BPM] bpm in the key of [Key]. Features [instrumentation].
   The mood is [emotional description] with [vocal style].

   [Intro] [description]
   [Verse] [description]
   [Chorus] [description]
   [Bridge] [description]
   [Outro] [description]
   ```
   **CRITICAL: Keep under 1000 characters**

8. **Output Format**
   Present both prompts with character counts:
   ```
   â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
   SUNO AI PROMPTS FOR: [Song Title]
   â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•

   ðŸ“Š SONG ANALYSIS
   â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
   Title: [title]
   Artist: [artist]
   Genre: [genre]
   BPM: [bpm]
   Key: [key]
   Mood: [mood description]

   ðŸŽ¹ STYLE PROMPT (for Suno "Style of Music" field)
   â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
   [Character count: XXX/1000]

   [Full style prompt here]

   âœï¸ LYRICS PROMPT (for Suno "Lyrics" field)
   â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
   [Character count: XXXX/5000]

   [Full structured lyrics here]

   â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
   ```

## Important Reminders

- Style prompt MUST be <1000 characters (strictly enforce)
- Lyrics prompt MUST be <5000 characters (strictly enforce)
- Show character counts for both
- Lyrics must be ORIGINAL, not copied
- Capture the VIBE/ESSENCE, not literal content
- Match the STRUCTURE and FLOW of the original

## Integration with Other Commands

```bash
# Download, analyze, create prompt
/media https://youtube.com/watch?v=... mp3
/suno https://youtube.com/watch?v=... "my custom topic"
```

## Reference Documentation

For detailed usage guide, see:
- `~/.claude/docs/suno-command-guide.md`

1. **Explicit Content**: Some of the phrases you've provided are sexually explicit. While I can help create edgy or provocative content in appropriate contexts, I want to make sure this aligns with your actual intent.

3. **Cultural Sensitivity**: You mentioned "Punjabi" - are you looking for:

I want to make sure I create something useful for you rather than just forcing explicit phrases into a song structure.

# Suno AI Prompt Generation Task

## AUDIO ANALYSIS DATA AVAILABLE

The song has been analyzed using professional audio analysis software (Essentia/Librosa).
Here is the ACCURATE audio analysis data:

```json
{
  "success": true,
  "bpm": 107.7,
  "key": "D",
  "scale": "minor",
  "key_confidence": 0.447,
  "num_beats": 503,
  "avg_energy": 0.205,
  "mood": "moderate, groovy, powerful",
  "duration_seconds": 301.7,
  "method": "librosa"
}
```

You MUST use this data for BPM, key, and mood instead of web searching.

## 1. STYLE PROMPT (strictly <1000 characters)

**Step 1: Use Provided Audio Analysis**
- BPM: Use the "bpm" value from analysis data
- Key: Use the "key" and "scale" values from analysis data
- Mood: Incorporate the "mood" description from analysis data
- Energy: Reference "avg_energy" and "dynamics" for intensity descriptions

**Step 2: Analyze Vocal Characteristics**
- Search for: "Audioslave - Like a Stone (Official Video) Audioslave vocal style tone delivery voice characteristics"
- Identify vocal elements:
  * **Vocal Range:** (tenor, baritone, alto, soprano, bass)
  * **Vocal Tone:** (smooth, raspy, breathy, crisp, warm, cold, robotic)
  * **Vocal Texture:** (clean, gritty, airy, compressed, lo-fi, polished)
  * **Delivery Style:** (laid-back, aggressive, confident, vulnerable, melodic, rhythmic)
  * **Vocal Effects:** (autotune level, reverb, delay, distortion, pitch correction)
  * **Unique Characteristics:** (falsetto, vocal fry, runs, ad-libs, melisma)
  * **Similar Artists:** (voice comparisons 4 reference)

**Step 3: Research Genre and Instrumentation**
- Search for: "Audioslave - Like a Stone (Official Video) Audioslave genre instrumentation production"
- Look for: genre classification, instrument breakdown, production style
- Identify: bass style, drums/percussion, melodic elements, synths, guitars, etc.
- Note: texture (dreamy, aggressive, clean, distorted), layering

**Step 3: Describe Beat/Rhythm**
- Use the detected BPM to inform rhythm description
- Identify rhythm pattern (Afrobeat, trap, boom-bap, etc.)
- Note: groove feel (laid-back, driving, syncopated)
- Percussion details: hi-hats, snares, kicks, shakers, cowbells, etc.

**Step 4: Create Voice Persona & Style Prompt**

First, create a voice persona summary:
```
PERSONA NAME: [Artist name or creative alias]

STYLES: [Genre 1], [Genre 2], [Genre 3], [Genre 4]

DESCRIPTION:
[Gender] vocalist with [range] range. Voice is [tone qualities] with [texture description]. Delivery is [style characteristics] with [unique elements]. Uses [effects] & [techniques]. Tone is [overall quality]. Similar 2: [Artist 1] meets [Artist 2] meets [Artist 3].
```

Then create the full style prompt:
```
A [mood] [genre] song at [BPM] bpm in [Key], [duration like 2:42 or 3:16]. [Gender] [range] - [vocal characteristics in 1 sentence]. Vocals [processing details]. [Tone description] - similar 2 [Artist]/[Artist]/[Artist]. Features [instrumentation list].

[Intro] [brief description with vocal elements]

[Verse] [brief description with vocal delivery]

[Hook/Chorus] [brief description with vocal techniques]

[Verse 2] [brief description with variations]

[Bridge] [brief description highlighting vocals]

[Outro] [brief description with fade elements]
```

**CRITICAL FORMATTING TIPS:**
- Keep descriptions VERY concise (5-10 words per section)
- Use abbreviations: & (and), 2 (to/too), 4 (for), r (are), u (you)
- Combine related ideas with commas, not full sentences
- Song duration format: "2:42 length" or "3:16" (converts seconds 2 minutes:seconds)
- Remove filler words like "the", "with a", "that features"
- Total must stay under 900 characters to account 4 Suno's counting differences

**CRITICAL: Keep total under 1000 characters**
**IMPORTANT: Use ONLY the BPM and key from the audio analysis data - do NOT search for or guess these values**

Based on the search results, here's what I found about "Like a Stone" by Audioslave:

## Genre
The song is classified as Alternative Rock. "Like a Stone" was nominated for Best Hard Rock Performance at the 46th Grammy Awards. Audioslave's overall sound was created by blending 1970s hard rock and 1990s alternative rock, with musical influences that included 1960s funk, soul and R&B.

## Instrumentation
The song is based around a simple guitar riff, and features one of guitarist Tom Morello's trademark high-pitched solos. The band prided themselves on the fact that all sounds on their albums were produced using only guitars, bass, drums, and vocals, with emphasis on Cornell's wide vocal range and Morello's unconventional guitar techniques, with no samples ever used.

## Production
The record and the song were produced by Rick Rubin and also by the band itself. The album received mixed reviews regarding productionâ€”some critics called producer Rick Rubin's work "a synthesized rock-like product that emits no heat", while others considered Rubin's production over-polished. The recording of the album was lengthy and took just less than a year, with the band recording in four different studios: Cello Studios, Hollywood, Royaltone Studios, Burbank, Studio Litho, Seattle and Studio K, Seattle.

Based on the search results, here's what I found about "Like a Stone" by Audioslave:

## Genre
The song is classified as Alternative Rock. "Like a Stone" was nominated for Best Hard Rock Performance at the 46th Grammy Awards. Audioslave's overall sound was created by blending 1970s hard rock and 1990s alternative rock, with musical influences that included 1960s funk, soul and R&B.

## Instrumentation
The song is based around a simple guitar riff, and features one of guitarist Tom Morello's trademark high-pitched solos. The band prided themselves on the fact that all sounds on their albums were produced using only guitars, bass, drums, and vocals, with emphasis on Cornell's wide vocal range and Morello's unconventional guitar techniques, with no samples ever used.

## Production
The record and the song were produced by Rick Rubin and also by the band itself. The album received mixed reviews regarding productionâ€”some critics called producer Rick Rubin's work "a synthesized rock-like product that emits no heat", while others considered Rubin's production over-polished. The recording of the album was lengthy and took just less than a year, with the band recording in four different studios: Cello Studios, Hollywood, Royaltone Studios, Burbank, Studio Litho, Seattle and Studio K, Seattle.

I found detailed information about Chris Cornell's vocal characteristics on "Like a Stone." Here's what the search revealed:

## Vocal Tone and Delivery

Cornell's voice on "Like a Stone" is described as "gravelly, soulful, and soaring," and he transitions seamlessly from a quiet, mournful tone in the verses to a powerful, cathartic release in the chorus. The performance features what few rock singers can achieve: turning a reflective lyric into an arena-worthy chorus, with the performance full of shadingâ€”longing, resignation, and a kind of spiritual suspense.

## Technical Characteristics

Cornell used very gentle glottal onsets to add attack as a stylistic choice, such as on the first 'all' to give it extra punch in the lower part of his range, then transitioning to simultaneous onset on the second 'all'. He had a warm baritone voice with the ability to rise through the registers into the tenor range with power and ease while maintaining his baritone warmth, and when younger, his voice had a thick honey tone with outstanding clarity and ease at the top of his range.

## Emotional Impact

While not the most ferocious vocal performance Cornell ever offered, the melancholic "Like a Stone" remains one of the highlights of his careerâ€”a genuinely heartfelt lyrical moment carried by his astounding vocal prowess. The vocal is not "pretty" in the traditional sense; it is persuasive.

## Who They Are
Piri (Sophie Leigh McBurnie, born March 14, 1999, in Rochdale, Greater Manchester) is half of the band Piri & Tommy, working alongside producer Tommy Villiers. They began writing together as Piri & Tommy after connecting via Instagram.

## Music Style
Their genres include Liquid Drum and Bass, Dance-Pop, and UK Garage. Their music fuses garage, drum and bass, and hyperpop influences into a unique sound that has resonated widely with Gen Z audiences.

More specifically:
- Their music features disco, house, drum 'n' bass, and speed garage
- Piri's soft-edged and naturally melodic voice pairs with 90s classics: finger-waving garage and dreamy drum and bass

## Notable Releases
- "Soft Spot" (June 2021) - a liquid drum and bass single that went viral on TikTok and Spotify
- "Beachin" - a jungle track, and "Words" - a garage song
- Their debut mixtape froge.mp3 dropped in 2022
- In 2025, they joined Denham Audio on the drum and bass track "Heavy Handed," blending airy vocals, jungle breaks, and pulsating basslines

content.text:
# Suno AI Prompt Generator

Analyzes songs and generates optimized prompts for Suno AI music generation. Creates both style and lyrics prompts that capture the essence of a song.

## Prerequisites

The command requires `yt-dlp` to be installed for YouTube URLs:

```bash
# macOS
brew install yt-dlp

# Linux
pip3 install yt-dlp
```

## Instructions

### Command Format

```bash
/suno <youtube-url|file-path> [topic]
```

**Parameters:**
- `youtube-url|file-path`: YouTube URL or path to audio file (required)
- `topic`: What the new song should be about (optional, defaults to "similar theme")

### What This Command Does

The `/suno` command generates TWO optimized prompts for Suno AI:

#### 1. Style Prompt (<1000 characters)
- Musical attributes (BPM, key, genre)
- Instrumentation details
- Beat/rhythm description
- Mood and atmosphere
- Section-by-section breakdown (intro, verse, chorus, etc.)

#### 2. Lyrics Prompt (<5000 characters)
- Original lyrics inspired by the source
- Matches the vibe and essence
- Follows same structure (verse/chorus/bridge)
- Uses similar rhyme schemes and patterns
- Based on your specified topic

### Examples

**Example 1: Analyze a YouTube video**
```bash
/suno https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RjKKOqHyD34
```

**Example 2: Custom topic**
```bash
/suno https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RjKKOqHyD34 "a song about chasing dreams"
```

**Example 3: Local audio file**
```bash
/suno ~/Music/my-song.mp3 "a song about heartbreak"
```

## Implementation Steps

When this command is invoked:

1. **Execute the skill script**
   ```bash
   ~/.claude/skills/suno.sh "$1" "$2"
   ```
   This will output the analysis instructions.

2. **Research Song Details**
   - Search for: "[Song Title] [Artist] BPM key genre"
   - Look for music databases (MusicStax, Tunebat, Song BPM, etc.)
   - Find: BPM, Key, Genre, Mood

3. **Analyze Instrumentation**
   - Search for: "[Song Title] instrumental breakdown" or "production analysis"
   - Identify: bass style, drums/percussion, melodic elements
   - Note: texture and layering

4. **Get Original Lyrics**
   - Search for: "[Song Title] [Artist] lyrics"
   - Analyze structure: verse/chorus/bridge layout
   - Note: rhyme schemes, line patterns

5. **Extract Vibe/Essence**
   - Theme: What is the song about?
   - Tone: Emotional quality
   - Imagery: Visual/sensory language
   - Voice: Perspective (first person, storytelling, etc.)

6. **Generate New Lyrics**
   - DO NOT copy original lyrics
   - CAPTURE the vibe, tone, and emotional essence
   - MATCH the structure (verse/chorus/bridge layout)
   - USE similar rhyme schemes and line patterns
   - KEEP total under 5000 characters

7. **Create Style Prompt**
   Format:
   ```
   A [mood] [genre] song at [BPM] bpm in the key of [Key]. Features [instrumentation].
   The mood is [emotional description] with [vocal style].

   [Intro] [description]
   [Verse] [description]
   [Chorus] [description]
   [Bridge] [description]
   [Outro] [description]
   ```
   **CRITICAL: Keep under 1000 characters**

8. **Output Format**
   Present both prompts with character counts:
   ```
   â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
   SUNO AI PROMPTS FOR: [Song Title]
   â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•

   ðŸ“Š SONG ANALYSIS
   â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
   Title: [title]
   Artist: [artist]
   Genre: [genre]
   BPM: [bpm]
   Key: [key]
   Mood: [mood description]

   ðŸŽ¹ STYLE PROMPT (for Suno "Style of Music" field)
   â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
   [Character count: XXX/1000]

   [Full style prompt here]

   âœï¸ LYRICS PROMPT (for Suno "Lyrics" field)
   â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
   [Character count: XXXX/5000]

   [Full structured lyrics here]

   â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
   ```

## Important Reminders

- Style prompt MUST be <1000 characters (strictly enforce)
- Lyrics prompt MUST be <5000 characters (strictly enforce)
- Show character counts for both
- Lyrics must be ORIGINAL, not copied
- Capture the VIBE/ESSENCE, not literal content
- Match the STRUCTURE and FLOW of the original

## Integration with Other Commands

```bash
# Download, analyze, create prompt
/media https://youtube.com/watch?v=... mp3
/suno https://youtube.com/watch?v=... "my custom topic"
```

## Reference Documentation

For detailed usage guide, see:
- `~/.claude/docs/suno-command-guide.md`

# Suno AI Prompt Generation Task

## AUDIO ANALYSIS DATA AVAILABLE

The song has been analyzed using professional audio analysis software (Essentia/Librosa).
Here is the ACCURATE audio analysis data:

```json
{
  "success": true,
  "bpm": 92.3,
  "key": "G",
  "scale": "major",
  "key_confidence": 0.57,
  "num_beats": 317,
  "avg_energy": 0.133,
  "mood": "moderate, groovy, powerful",
  "duration_seconds": 236.6,
  "method": "librosa"
}
```

You MUST use this data for BPM, key, and mood instead of web searching.

## 1. STYLE PROMPT (strictly <1000 characters)

**Step 1: Use Provided Audio Analysis**
- BPM: Use the "bpm" value from analysis data
- Key: Use the "key" and "scale" values from analysis data
- Mood: Incorporate the "mood" description from analysis data
- Energy: Reference "avg_energy" and "dynamics" for intensity descriptions

**Step 2: Analyze Vocal Characteristics**
- Search for: "Radiohead - Creep Radiohead vocal style tone delivery voice characteristics"
- Identify vocal elements:
  * **Vocal Range:** (tenor, baritone, alto, soprano, bass)
  * **Vocal Tone:** (smooth, raspy, breathy, crisp, warm, cold, robotic)
  * **Vocal Texture:** (clean, gritty, airy, compressed, lo-fi, polished)
  * **Delivery Style:** (laid-back, aggressive, confident, vulnerable, melodic, rhythmic)
  * **Vocal Effects:** (autotune level, reverb, delay, distortion, pitch correction)
  * **Unique Characteristics:** (falsetto, vocal fry, runs, ad-libs, melisma)
  * **Similar Artists:** (voice comparisons 4 reference)

**Step 3: Research Genre and Instrumentation**
- Search for: "Radiohead - Creep Radiohead genre instrumentation production"
- Look for: genre classification, instrument breakdown, production style
- Identify: bass style, drums/percussion, melodic elements, synths, guitars, etc.
- Note: texture (dreamy, aggressive, clean, distorted), layering

**Step 3: Describe Beat/Rhythm**
- Use the detected BPM to inform rhythm description
- Identify rhythm pattern (Afrobeat, trap, boom-bap, etc.)
- Note: groove feel (laid-back, driving, syncopated)
- Percussion details: hi-hats, snares, kicks, shakers, cowbells, etc.

**Step 4: Create Voice Persona & Style Prompt**

First, create a voice persona summary:
```
PERSONA NAME: [Artist name or creative alias]

STYLES: [Genre 1], [Genre 2], [Genre 3], [Genre 4]

DESCRIPTION:
[Gender] vocalist with [range] range. Voice is [tone qualities] with [texture description]. Delivery is [style characteristics] with [unique elements]. Uses [effects] & [techniques]. Tone is [overall quality]. Similar 2: [Artist 1] meets [Artist 2] meets [Artist 3].
```

Then create the full style prompt:
```
A [mood] [genre] song at [BPM] bpm in [Key], [duration like 2:42 or 3:16]. [Gender] [range] - [vocal characteristics in 1 sentence]. Vocals [processing details]. [Tone description] - similar 2 [Artist]/[Artist]/[Artist]. Features [instrumentation list].

[Intro] [brief description with vocal elements]

[Verse] [brief description with vocal delivery]

[Hook/Chorus] [brief description with vocal techniques]

[Verse 2] [brief description with variations]

[Bridge] [brief description highlighting vocals]

[Outro] [brief description with fade elements]
```

**CRITICAL FORMATTING TIPS:**
- Keep descriptions VERY concise (5-10 words per section)
- Use abbreviations: & (and), 2 (to/too), 4 (for), r (are), u (you)
- Combine related ideas with commas, not full sentences
- Song duration format: "2:42 length" or "3:16" (converts seconds 2 minutes:seconds)
- Remove filler words like "the", "with a", "that features"
- Total must stay under 900 characters to account 4 Suno's counting differences

**CRITICAL: Keep total under 1000 characters**
**IMPORTANT: Use ONLY the BPM and key from the audio analysis data - do NOT search for or guess these values**

I found information about the song structure of Radiohead's "Creep." Here's what the search revealed:

## Song Structure

The song has sections including Intro and Verse, Verse, Chorus, and Bridge. The Verse and Chorus are repeated twice in the pattern: Verse 1 â€“ Chorus 1 â€“ Verse 2 â€“ Chorus 2. The eight bars of the Bridge are repeated twice.

The complete structure follows this pattern:
- Intro
- Verse 1
- Chorus 1
- Verse 2
- Chorus 2
- Bridge (repeated)
- Outro

## Musical Details

When the song shifts from the verse to the chorus, Jonny Greenwood plays three blasts of guitar noise ("dead notes"), which became one of the song's most distinctive features.

The bridge features a fairly simple chord progression that is memorable for its fusion of diatonic and chromatic elements, creating a sense of tension and interest.

The song uses a repeating four-chord progression (G, B, C, Cm) throughout most of its sections, making it relatively simple structurally but emotionally powerful in its execution.

When the song shifts from the verse to the chorus, Jonny Greenwood plays three blasts of guitar noise ("dead notes"), which became one of the song's most distinctive features.

The bridge features a fairly simple chord progression that is memorable for its fusion of diatonic and chromatic elements, creating a sense of tension and interest.

The song uses a repeating four-chord progression (G, B, C, Cm) throughout most of its sections, making it relatively simple structurally but emotionally powerful in its execution.

Based on my search results, here's information about Radiohead's "Creep" regarding its genre, instrumentation, guitar production, and place in alternative rock:

## Genre

The song is classified as alternative rock and became popular on American alternative rock radio. It was likened to alt-rock "slacker anthems" such as "Smells Like Teen Spirit" by Nirvana and "Loser" by Beck.

## Instrumentation

The instrumentation includes a prominent electric guitar, bass, drums and keyboards, creating a melancholic and vulnerable atmosphere, which is accentuated by Thom Yorke's emotive voice. The band's decision to include a Hammond organ in the mix adds a layer of depth and warmth to the overall sound.

## Guitar and Production

The guitar work is a defining element of the song. It features "blasts" of guitar noise, and the song's hook is the razor-sharp guitar play that frames Yorke's gnashing of teeth. Those jarring, splenetic razor-slashes of distorted guitar kick the song up several gears, sparking its smouldering self-disgust into something closer to cathartic rage.

The guitar riff echoes the grunge sound that was prevalent during the early 90s. Paul Kolderie and Sean Slade, who had worked with the US bands the Pixies and Dinosaur Jr., were enlisted to produce Radiohead's debut album, Pablo Honey, recorded quickly in Oxford in 1992.

The song's importance to alternative rock is significant, as this anthem of alienation, with its introspective lyrics and unforgettable guitar riff, became a staple of the alternative rock genre and solidified its place in music history.

I found comprehensive information about Thom Yorke's vocal style, tone, and delivery characteristics on "Creep." Here's what the search revealed:

## Vocal Tone & Delivery Characteristics

Yorke's delivery is a mix of vulnerability and aggression, perfectly capturing the song's themes of self-loathing and despair.(no content)His voice shifts between a soft, almost fragile tone in the verses and a mighty, anguished cry in the chorus.(no content)Thom Yorke delivers a performance that oscillates between self-loathing fragility and explosive anger.

## Specific Vocal Techniques

**Verse Delivery:** In the verses, Yorke uses a "breathy" tone, letting more air escape through the vocal cords than usual.

**Overall Approach:** Thom Yorke's smooth, sedated vocal approach sounds simple enough, and there is a true art form in being able to sound detached and emotionally engaged at the same time.

**General Vocal Qualities:** His singing combines fragility and power. His high falsetto blends seamlessly with his lower register, resulting in a compelling and haunting sound.

**Nasal Quality:** Thom uses a lot of nasal resonance mixed with a chesty drag, directing the sound slightly into the nose ("twang") to get that signature whining quality.

## Comparison & Critical Reception

Larry Flick of Billboard wrote that the track features "an appropriately languid, melodic vocal (which also vaults into Bono-esque falsetto range)."(no content)The raw, cathartic quality of "Creep" caused an immediate stir, according to producer Paul Kolderie.

# /extract1 - Standard Quality Vocal Extraction

Fast vocal extraction using Demucs AI. Good quality in ~2 minutes.

## Quick Usage

```
/extract1 https://youtu.be/VIDEO_ID
/extract1 https://youtu.be/VIDEO_ID "Artist - Song Title"
/extract1 ~/Music/song.mp3
/extract1 ~/Music/song.mp3 "Custom Name"
```

## Features

- âš¡ **Fast**: ~2 minutes for 3-4 min songs
- ðŸŽµ **Quality**: Good (SDR ~8.0 vocals, ~11.0 instrumental)
- ðŸ’¾ **Output**: ~/Desktop/MediaVault_v2/separated_vocals/
- ðŸ“¦ **Model**: Demucs htdemucs
- ðŸŽ›ï¸  **Auto-Muffle**: Instrumental automatically muffled (lo-fi effect)

## Instructions

Parse the arguments from: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JdgiTDEDfQg mp3

/suno make the song a story and it should include the following theme. The lyrics should be in Russian
Epoch

Velvet

Quartz

Lantern

Orbit

Jasmine

Cobblestone

### Execute the Extraction

```bash
# Get the input and optional song name from arguments
~/.claude/skills/extract1.sh https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JdgiTDEDfQg mp3

/suno make the song a story and it should include the following theme. The lyrics should be in Russian
Epoch

Velvet

Circuit

Meadow

Whisper

Quartz

Lantern

Orbit

Jasmine

Cobblestone
```

The script will:
1. Accept audio file or YouTube URL
2. Download if needed (YouTube)
3. Separate vocals and instrumentals using Demucs
4. Apply muffling/muddling effects to instrumental (auto)
5. Save to MediaVault_v2/separated_vocals/

### Output Files

After completion, you'll find:
- [Song Name] - Vocals.wav (44.1kHz, pristine)
- [Song Name] - Instrumental.wav (32kHz, muffled/muddled)
- [Song Name] - Original.wav
- info.txt (metadata)

### Post-Processing Applied

The instrumental is automatically processed with:
- Lowpass filter at 3kHz (removes high frequencies)
- Highpass filter at 100Hz (removes rumble)
- Downsampled to 32kHz (reduced clarity)
- 5% random noise (muddling effect)
- 80% volume (softer sound)

### When to Use

Use `/extract1` when:
- You need quick results
- Good quality is sufficient
- Processing time matters

For maximum quality (slower), use `/extract2` instead.

## 1. STYLE PROMPT (strictly <1000 characters)

**Step 1: Use Provided Audio Analysis**
- BPM: Use the "bpm" value from analysis data
- Key: Use the "key" and "scale" values from analysis data
- Mood: Incorporate the "mood" description from analysis data
- Energy: Reference "avg_energy" and "dynamics" for intensity descriptions

**Step 2: Analyze Vocal Characteristics**
- Search for: "LOVANDA  - Ð’Ð•ÐÐ•Ð Ð ENCORE vocal style tone delivery voice characteristics"
- Identify vocal elements:
  * **Vocal Range:** (tenor, baritone, alto, soprano, bass)
  * **Vocal Tone:** (smooth, raspy, breathy, crisp, warm, cold, robotic)
  * **Vocal Texture:** (clean, gritty, airy, compressed, lo-fi, polished)
  * **Delivery Style:** (laid-back, aggressive, confident, vulnerable, melodic, rhythmic)
  * **Vocal Effects:** (autotune level, reverb, delay, distortion, pitch correction)
  * **Unique Characteristics:** (falsetto, vocal fry, runs, ad-libs, melisma)
  * **Similar Artists:** (voice comparisons 4 reference)

**Step 3: Research Genre and Instrumentation**
- Search for: "LOVANDA  - Ð’Ð•ÐÐ•Ð Ð ENCORE genre instrumentation production"
- Look for: genre classification, instrument breakdown, production style
- Identify: bass style, drums/percussion, melodic elements, synths, guitars, etc.
- Note: texture (dreamy, aggressive, clean, distorted), layering

**Step 3: Describe Beat/Rhythm**
- Use the detected BPM to inform rhythm description
- Identify rhythm pattern (Afrobeat, trap, boom-bap, etc.)
- Note: groove feel (laid-back, driving, syncopated)
- Percussion details: hi-hats, snares, kicks, shakers, cowbells, etc.

**Step 4: Create Voice Persona & Style Prompt**

First, create a voice persona summary:
```
PERSONA NAME: [Artist name or creative alias]

STYLES: [Genre 1], [Genre 2], [Genre 3], [Genre 4]

DESCRIPTION:
[Gender] vocalist with [range] range. Voice is [tone qualities] with [texture description]. Delivery is [style characteristics] with [unique elements]. Uses [effects] & [techniques]. Tone is [overall quality]. Similar 2: [Artist 1] meets [Artist 2] meets [Artist 3].
```

Then create the full style prompt:
```
A [mood] [genre] song at [BPM] bpm in [Key], [duration like 2:42 or 3:16]. [Gender] [range] - [vocal characteristics in 1 sentence]. Vocals [processing details]. [Tone description] - similar 2 [Artist]/[Artist]/[Artist]. Features [instrumentation list].

[Intro] [brief description with vocal elements]

[Verse] [brief description with vocal delivery]

[Hook/Chorus] [brief description with vocal techniques]

[Verse 2] [brief description with variations]

[Bridge] [brief description highlighting vocals]

[Outro] [brief description with fade elements]
```

**CRITICAL FORMATTING TIPS:**
- Keep descriptions VERY concise (5-10 words per section)
- Use abbreviations: & (and), 2 (to/too), 4 (for), r (are), u (you)
- Combine related ideas with commas, not full sentences
- Song duration format: "2:42 length" or "3:16" (converts seconds 2 minutes:seconds)
- Remove filler words like "the", "with a", "that features"
- Total must stay under 900 characters to account 4 Suno's counting differences

**CRITICAL: Keep total under 1000 characters**
**IMPORTANT: Use ONLY the BPM and key from the audio analysis data - do NOT search for or guess these values**

I've found information about Russian pop, hip hop, and trap production styles and instrumentation. Here's a summary of what the search revealed:

## Russian Trap Music Characteristics

### Production Style & Instrumentation

Russian trap is characterized by its heavy use of synthesizers, 808 drums, and dark, aggressive lyrics.(no content)The genre features heavy use of trap beats and electronic instrumentation.

### Cultural Fusion Elements

Russian trap often features a mix of Russian and English lyrics, and samples from Russian folk music.(no content)The genre draws influence from global trap, hip hop, and electronic music, providing a unique twist with its darker tones and distinctive use of Russian folk instruments and melodies.

### Folk Trap Subgenre

Folk Trap integrates traditional Russian folk music with modern trap beats, using instruments like balalaikas or domras, creating a fusion of contemporary urban sound and historical Russian melodies.

### General Trap Production Elements

Trap music employs multilayered monophonic drones with sometimes a melodic accompaniment expressed with synthesizers; crisp, grimy, and rhythmic snares, deep 808 kick drums, double-time, triple-time hi-hats, and a cinematic and symphonic use of synthesized string, brass, woodwind, and keyboard instruments.

### Related Genre: Hookah Rap

Hookah rap intersects with the production style of hip hop music, trap music and house music, taking use of melodies from Arabic music, music of the Middle East, and music of Central Asia.(no content)The vocals in hookah rap are performed with indistinct intonation and a lot of pitch correction (autotune).

The search results indicate that Russian trap combines traditional trap production elements (808s, synthesizers, complex hi-hats) with unique cultural elements including Russian folk instruments and melodies, creating a distinct sound that reflects both global trap influences and regional musical traditions.

results:
I've found information about Russian pop, hip hop, and trap production styles and instrumentation. Here's a summary of what the search revealed:

## Russian Trap Music Characteristics

### Production Style & Instrumentation

Russian trap is characterized by its heavy use of synthesizers, 808 drums, and dark, aggressive lyrics.(no content)The genre features heavy use of trap beats and electronic instrumentation.

### Cultural Fusion Elements

Russian trap often features a mix of Russian and English lyrics, and samples from Russian folk music.(no content)The genre draws influence from global trap, hip hop, and electronic music, providing a unique twist with its darker tones and distinctive use of Russian folk instruments and melodies.

### Folk Trap Subgenre

Folk Trap integrates traditional Russian folk music with modern trap beats, using instruments like balalaikas or domras, creating a fusion of contemporary urban sound and historical Russian melodies.

### General Trap Production Elements

Trap music employs multilayered monophonic drones with sometimes a melodic accompaniment expressed with synthesizers; crisp, grimy, and rhythmic snares, deep 808 kick drums, double-time, triple-time hi-hats, and a cinematic and symphonic use of synthesized string, brass, woodwind, and keyboard instruments.

### Related Genre: Hookah Rap

Hookah rap intersects with the production style of hip hop music, trap music and house music, taking use of melodies from Arabic music, music of the Middle East, and music of Central Asia.(no content)The vocals in hookah rap are performed with indistinct intonation and a lot of pitch correction (autotune).

The search results indicate that Russian trap combines traditional trap production elements (808s, synthesizers, complex hi-hats) with unique cultural elements including Russian folk instruments and melodies, creating a distinct sound that reflects both global trap influences and regional musical traditions.

content.text:
# /extract1 - Standard Quality Vocal Extraction

Fast vocal extraction using Demucs AI. Good quality in ~2 minutes.

## Quick Usage

```
/extract1 https://youtu.be/VIDEO_ID
/extract1 https://youtu.be/VIDEO_ID "Artist - Song Title"
/extract1 ~/Music/song.mp3
/extract1 ~/Music/song.mp3 "Custom Name"
```

## Features

- âš¡ **Fast**: ~2 minutes for 3-4 min songs
- ðŸŽµ **Quality**: Good (SDR ~8.0 vocals, ~11.0 instrumental)
- ðŸ’¾ **Output**: ~/Desktop/MediaVault_v2/separated_vocals/
- ðŸ“¦ **Model**: Demucs htdemucs
- ðŸŽ›ï¸  **Auto-Muffle**: Instrumental automatically muffled (lo-fi effect)

## Instructions

Parse the arguments from: https://youtu.be/-cCJxjGX-hs

/suno Make a song about a girl being impressed by the guy she just started dating, that she is suprised at how much of a man that he is compared to other guys. this guy is confident, he is the man. She is suprised at how similar they think about things and it makes her question herself. She feel a certain way that makes her confused, doesn't trust him, but can't help but explore her curiosity and keep seeing this guy. Even though it is so new for her it is exciting and fun, and she cant control herself around him.

### Execute the Extraction

```bash
# Get the input and optional song name from arguments
~/.claude/skills/extract1.sh https://youtu.be/-cCJxjGX-hs

/suno Make a song about a girl being impressed by the guy she just started dating, that she is suprised at how much of a man that he is compared to other guys. this guy is confident, he is the man. She is suprised at how similar they think about things and it makes her question herself. She feel a certain way that makes her confused, doesn't trust him, but can't help but explore her curiosity and keep seeing this guy. Even though it is so new for her it is exciting and fun, and she cant control herself around him.
```

The script will:
1. Accept audio file or YouTube URL
2. Download if needed (YouTube)
3. Separate vocals and instrumentals using Demucs
4. Apply muffling/muddling effects to instrumental (auto)
5. Save to MediaVault_v2/separated_vocals/

### Output Files

After completion, you'll find:
- [Song Name] - Vocals.wav (44.1kHz, pristine)
- [Song Name] - Instrumental.wav (32kHz, muffled/muddled)
- [Song Name] - Original.wav
- info.txt (metadata)

### Post-Processing Applied

The instrumental is automatically processed with:
- Lowpass filter at 3kHz (removes high frequencies)
- Highpass filter at 100Hz (removes rumble)
- Downsampled to 32kHz (reduced clarity)
- 5% random noise (muddling effect)
- 80% volume (softer sound)

### When to Use

Use `/extract1` when:
- You need quick results
- Good quality is sufficient
- Processing time matters

For maximum quality (slower), use `/extract2` instead.
I'll execute both commands for you - first extracting the vocals, then creating the Suno prompt.

You MUST use this data for BPM, key, and mood instead of web searching.

## 1. STYLE PROMPT (strictly <1000 characters)

**Step 1: Use Provided Audio Analysis**
- BPM: Use the "bpm" value from analysis data
- Key: Use the "key" and "scale" values from analysis data
- Mood: Incorporate the "mood" description from analysis data
- Energy: Reference "avg_energy" and "dynamics" for intensity descriptions

**Step 2: Analyze Vocal Characteristics**
- Search for: "Skryptonite - Ð½Ðµ Ñ€Ð°ÑÑÐ»Ð°Ð±Ð»ÑÐ¹ÑÑ/donâ€™t relax (English Subtitles) KILL ME, V1SA vocal style tone delivery voice characteristics"
- Identify vocal elements:
  * **Vocal Range:** (tenor, baritone, alto, soprano, bass)
  * **Vocal Tone:** (smooth, raspy, breathy, crisp, warm, cold, robotic)
  * **Vocal Texture:** (clean, gritty, airy, compressed, lo-fi, polished)
  * **Delivery Style:** (laid-back, aggressive, confident, vulnerable, melodic, rhythmic)
  * **Vocal Effects:** (autotune level, reverb, delay, distortion, pitch correction)
  * **Unique Characteristics:** (falsetto, vocal fry, runs, ad-libs, melisma)
  * **Similar Artists:** (voice comparisons 4 reference)

**Step 3: Research Genre and Instrumentation**
- Search for: "Skryptonite - Ð½Ðµ Ñ€Ð°ÑÑÐ»Ð°Ð±Ð»ÑÐ¹ÑÑ/donâ€™t relax (English Subtitles) KILL ME, V1SA genre instrumentation production"
- Look for: genre classification, instrument breakdown, production style
- Identify: bass style, drums/percussion, melodic elements, synths, guitars, etc.
- Note: texture (dreamy, aggressive, clean, distorted), layering

**Step 3: Describe Beat/Rhythm**
- Use the detected BPM to inform rhythm description
- Identify rhythm pattern (Afrobeat, trap, boom-bap, etc.)
- Note: groove feel (laid-back, driving, syncopated)
- Percussion details: hi-hats, snares, kicks, shakers, cowbells, etc.

**Step 4: Create Voice Persona & Style Prompt**

First, create a voice persona summary:
```
PERSONA NAME: [Artist name or creative alias]

STYLES: [Genre 1], [Genre 2], [Genre 3], [Genre 4]

DESCRIPTION:
[Gender] vocalist with [range] range. Voice is [tone qualities] with [texture description]. Delivery is [style characteristics] with [unique elements]. Uses [effects] & [techniques]. Tone is [overall quality]. Similar 2: [Artist 1] meets [Artist 2] meets [Artist 3].
```

Then create the full style prompt:
```
A [mood] [genre] song at [BPM] bpm in [Key], [duration like 2:42 or 3:16]. [Gender] [range] - [vocal characteristics in 1 sentence]. Vocals [processing details]. [Tone description] - similar 2 [Artist]/[Artist]/[Artist]. Features [instrumentation list].

[Intro] [brief description with vocal elements]

[Verse] [brief description with vocal delivery]

[Hook/Chorus] [brief description with vocal techniques]

[Verse 2] [brief description with variations]

[Bridge] [brief description highlighting vocals]

[Outro] [brief description with fade elements]
```

**CRITICAL FORMATTING TIPS:**
- Keep descriptions VERY concise (5-10 words per section)
- Use abbreviations: & (and), 2 (to/too), 4 (for), r (are), u (you)
- Combine related ideas with commas, not full sentences
- Song duration format: "2:42 length" or "3:16" (converts seconds 2 minutes:seconds)
- Remove filler words like "the", "with a", "that features"
- Total must stay under 900 characters to account 4 Suno's counting differences

**CRITICAL: Keep total under 1000 characters**
**IMPORTANT: Use ONLY the BPM and key from the audio analysis data - do NOT search for or guess these values**

  * **Vocal Tone:** (smooth, raspy, breathy, crisp, warm, cold, robotic)
  * **Vocal Texture:** (clean, gritty, airy, compressed, lo-fi, polished)
  * **Delivery Style:** (laid-back, aggressive, confident, vulnerable, melodic, rhythmic)
  * **Vocal Effects:** (autotune level, reverb, delay, distortion, pitch correction)
  * **Unique Characteristics:** (falsetto, vocal fry, runs, ad-libs, melisma)
  * **Similar Artists:** (voice comparisons 4 reference)

**Step 3: Research Genre and Instrumentation**
- Search for: "Skryptonite - Ð½Ðµ Ñ€Ð°ÑÑÐ»Ð°Ð±Ð»ÑÐ¹ÑÑ/donâ€™t relax (English Subtitles) KILL ME, V1SA genre instrumentation production"
- Look for: genre classification, instrument breakdown, production style
- Identify: bass style, drums/percussion, melodic elements, synths, guitars, etc.
- Note: texture (dreamy, aggressive, clean, distorted), layering

**Step 3: Describe Beat/Rhythm**
- Use the detected BPM to inform rhythm description
- Identify rhythm pattern (Afrobeat, trap, boom-bap, etc.)
- Note: groove feel (laid-back, driving, syncopated)
- Percussion details: hi-hats, snares, kicks, shakers, cowbells, etc.

**Step 4: Create Voice Persona & Style Prompt**

First, create a voice persona summary:
```
PERSONA NAME: [Artist name or creative alias]

STYLES: [Genre 1], [Genre 2], [Genre 3], [Genre 4]

DESCRIPTION:
[Gender] vocalist with [range] range. Voice is [tone qualities] with [texture description]. Delivery is [style characteristics] with [unique elements]. Uses [effects] & [techniques]. Tone is [overall quality]. Similar 2: [Artist 1] meets [Artist 2] meets [Artist 3].
```

Then create the full style prompt:
```
A [mood] [genre] song at [BPM] bpm in [Key], [duration like 2:42 or 3:16]. [Gender] [range] - [vocal characteristics in 1 sentence]. Vocals [processing details]. [Tone description] - similar 2 [Artist]/[Artist]/[Artist]. Features [instrumentation list].

[Hook/Chorus] [brief description with vocal techniques]

[Verse 2] [brief description with variations]

[Bridge] [brief description highlighting vocals]

[Outro] [brief description with fade elements]
```

**CRITICAL FORMATTING TIPS:**
- Keep descriptions VERY concise (5-10 words per section)
- Use abbreviations: & (and), 2 (to/too), 4 (for), r (are), u (you)
- Combine related ideas with commas, not full sentences
- Song duration format: "2:42 length" or "3:16" (converts seconds 2 minutes:seconds)
- Remove filler words like "the", "with a", "that features"

I found information about Skryptonite, a prominent Russian-language rapper from Kazakhstan, and his distinctive vocal style. Here's what the search revealed:

## Skryptonite's Vocal Style

Skryptonite is known for his "distinct vocal deliveryâ€”a slurred, laid-back style humorously dubbed 'Yeltsin-flow'" which has become one of his signature characteristics in Russian hip-hop.

His vocal approach is unusual - he sometimes raps or sings, but other times he shouts or goes into a sort of bizarre whaling that sounds like he is crying, creating an emotionally intense performance style. His rap delivery is also often offbeat, coming across more like slam poetry but lacking slam poetry's rigidness, giving it a looser and more unpredictable freeness.

## Musical Approach

Unlike many Russian-language rappers who prioritize complex lyricism, Skryptonite emphasizes production and musicality, often handling composition and instrumentation himself. Much of his sampling is done using live instruments in the studio, and the sound is then processed to give it the sort of vintage feel you would expect from American rappers of the 90s such as Mobb Deep.

## Background

Ã„dÄ±l OralbekÅ«ly JÃ¤lelov (born 3 June 1990), known professionally as Skryptonite, is a Kazakh rapper, singer, songwriter, and music producer, and in 2021, Skryptonite was named the most-streamed artist in the Commonwealth of Independent States (CIS).

## How to Use in Suno AI:

1. **Create New Song** in Suno
2. **Paste Style Prompt** into "Style of Music" field
3. **Paste Lyrics** (Russian version above) into "Lyrics" field  
4. **Generate** and let Suno create your track!

## Notes:
- **All lyrics now in Russian** maintaining original themes
- **Key emotions preserved**: Confusion, excitement, lack of control, curiosity
- **"ÐœÑƒÐ¶Ñ‡Ð¸Ð½Ð° vs Ð¼Ð°Ð»ÑŒÑ‡Ð¸Ðº"**: Man vs boy comparison throughout
- **Trust issues**: "ÐÐµ Ð´Ð¾Ð²ÐµÑ€ÑÑŽ" (don't trust) but "Ð½Ðµ Ð¼Ð¾Ð³Ñƒ ÑÐ´ÐµÑ€Ð¶Ð°Ñ‚ÑŒÑÑ" (can't help myself)
- **Similarity theme**: "Ð”ÑƒÐ¼Ð°ÐµÐ¼ Ð¾Ð´Ð¸Ð½Ð°ÐºÐ¾Ð²Ð¾" creates self-questioning
- Hip-hop/trap production with Russian melodic vocals
- Natural Russian flow for 129 BPM trap beat
- Maintains Skryptonite-inspired laid-back delivery style

**Sources:**
- [Skryptonite Vocal Style](https://popkult.org/scriptonite/)
- [Russian Hip-Hop Production](https://www.chosic.com/genre-chart/russian-trap/)

content.text:
# Suno AI Prompt Generator

Analyzes songs and generates optimized prompts for Suno AI music generation. Creates both style and lyrics prompts that capture the essence of a song.

## Prerequisites

The command requires `yt-dlp` to be installed for YouTube URLs:

```bash
# macOS
brew install yt-dlp

# Linux
pip3 install yt-dlp
```

## Instructions

### Command Format

```bash
/suno <youtube-url|file-path> [topic]
```

**Parameters:**
- `youtube-url|file-path`: YouTube URL or path to audio file (required)
- `topic`: What the new song should be about (optional, defaults to "similar theme")

### What This Command Does

The `/suno` command generates TWO optimized prompts for Suno AI:

#### 1. Style Prompt (<1000 characters)
- Musical attributes (BPM, key, genre)
- Instrumentation details
- Beat/rhythm description
- Mood and atmosphere
- Section-by-section breakdown (intro, verse, chorus, etc.)

#### 2. Lyrics Prompt (<5000 characters)
- Original lyrics inspired by the source
- Matches the vibe and essence
- Follows same structure (verse/chorus/bridge)
- Uses similar rhyme schemes and patterns
- Based on your specified topic

### Examples

**Example 1: Analyze a YouTube video**
```bash
/suno https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RjKKOqHyD34
```

**Example 2: Custom topic**
```bash
/suno https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RjKKOqHyD34 "a song about chasing dreams"
```

**Example 3: Local audio file**
```bash
/suno ~/Music/my-song.mp3 "a song about heartbreak"
```

## Implementation Steps

When this command is invoked:

1. **Execute the skill script**
   ```bash
   ~/.claude/skills/suno.sh "$1" "$2"
   ```
   This will output the analysis instructions.

2. **Research Song Details**
   - Search for: "[Song Title] [Artist] BPM key genre"
   - Look for music databases (MusicStax, Tunebat, Song BPM, etc.)
   - Find: BPM, Key, Genre, Mood

3. **Analyze Instrumentation**
   - Search for: "[Song Title] instrumental breakdown" or "production analysis"
   - Identify: bass style, drums/percussion, melodic elements
   - Note: texture and layering

4. **Get Original Lyrics**
   - Search for: "[Song Title] [Artist] lyrics"
   - Analyze structure: verse/chorus/bridge layout
   - Note: rhyme schemes, line patterns

5. **Extract Vibe/Essence**
   - Theme: What is the song about?
   - Tone: Emotional quality
   - Imagery: Visual/sensory language
   - Voice: Perspective (first person, storytelling, etc.)

6. **Generate New Lyrics**
   - DO NOT copy original lyrics
   - CAPTURE the vibe, tone, and emotional essence
   - MATCH the structure (verse/chorus/bridge layout)
   - USE similar rhyme schemes and line patterns
   - KEEP total under 5000 characters

7. **Create Style Prompt**
   Format:
   ```
   A [mood] [genre] song at [BPM] bpm in the key of [Key]. Features [instrumentation].
   The mood is [emotional description] with [vocal style].

   [Intro] [description]
   [Verse] [description]
   [Chorus] [description]
   [Bridge] [description]
   [Outro] [description]
   ```
   **CRITICAL: Keep under 1000 characters**

8. **Output Format**
   Present both prompts with character counts:
   ```
   â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
   SUNO AI PROMPTS FOR: [Song Title]
   â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•

   ðŸ“Š SONG ANALYSIS
   â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
   Title: [title]
   Artist: [artist]
   Genre: [genre]
   BPM: [bpm]
   Key: [key]
   Mood: [mood description]

   ðŸŽ¹ STYLE PROMPT (for Suno "Style of Music" field)
   â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
   [Character count: XXX/1000]

   [Full style prompt here]

   âœï¸ LYRICS PROMPT (for Suno "Lyrics" field)
   â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
   [Character count: XXXX/5000]

   [Full structured lyrics here]

   â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
   ```

## Important Reminders

- Style prompt MUST be <1000 characters (strictly enforce)
- Lyrics prompt MUST be <5000 characters (strictly enforce)
- Show character counts for both
- Lyrics must be ORIGINAL, not copied
- Capture the VIBE/ESSENCE, not literal content
- Match the STRUCTURE and FLOW of the original

## Integration with Other Commands

```bash
# Download, analyze, create prompt
/media https://youtube.com/watch?v=... mp3
/suno https://youtube.com/watch?v=... "my custom topic"
```

## Reference Documentation

For detailed usage guide, see:
- `~/.claude/docs/suno-command-guide.md`


ARGUMENTS: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-V-sywKOCwQ

Make the song about laughing at yourself for the dumb decisions that you made in the past, but you've grown and you've learn. Now you get any woman you want and got the nicest boots in town.
I'll analyze the song and create Suno AI prompts about growth, self-reflection, and success.

# Suno AI Prompt Generation Task

## AUDIO ANALYSIS DATA AVAILABLE

The song has been analyzed using professional audio analysis software (Essentia/Librosa).
Here is the ACCURATE audio analysis data:

```json
{
  "success": true,
  "bpm": 99.4,
  "key": "B",
  "scale": "minor",
  "key_confidence": 0.521,
  "num_beats": 238,
  "avg_energy": 0.252,
  "mood": "moderate, groovy, powerful",
  "duration_seconds": 151.2,
  "method": "librosa"
}
```

You MUST use this data for BPM, key, and mood instead of web searching.

## 1. STYLE PROMPT (strictly <1000 characters)

**Step 1: Use Provided Audio Analysis**
- BPM: Use the "bpm" value from analysis data
- Key: Use the "key" and "scale" values from analysis data
- Mood: Incorporate the "mood" description from analysis data
- Energy: Reference "avg_energy" and "dynamics" for intensity descriptions

**Step 2: Analyze Vocal Characteristics**
- Search for: "Luis R Conriquez, Neton Vega - Si No Quieres No [Video Oficial] Luis R Conriquez vocal style tone delivery voice characteristics"
- Identify vocal elements:
  * **Vocal Range:** (tenor, baritone, alto, soprano, bass)
  * **Vocal Tone:** (smooth, raspy, breathy, crisp, warm, cold, robotic)
  * **Vocal Texture:** (clean, gritty, airy, compressed, lo-fi, polished)
  * **Delivery Style:** (laid-back, aggressive, confident, vulnerable, melodic, rhythmic)
  * **Vocal Effects:** (autotune level, reverb, delay, distortion, pitch correction)
  * **Unique Characteristics:** (falsetto, vocal fry, runs, ad-libs, melisma)
  * **Similar Artists:** (voice comparisons 4 reference)

**Step 3: Research Genre and Instrumentation**
- Search for: "Luis R Conriquez, Neton Vega - Si No Quieres No [Video Oficial] Luis R Conriquez genre instrumentation production"
- Look for: genre classification, instrument breakdown, production style
- Identify: bass style, drums/percussion, melodic elements, synths, guitars, etc.

## How to Use in Suno AI:

1. **Create New Song** in Suno
2. **Paste Style Prompt** into "Style of Music" field
3. **Paste Lyrics** into "Lyrics" field  
4. **Generate** and let Suno create your track!

## Notes:
- **Mexican slang incorporated throughout**:
  - "Compa" (buddy/friend)
  - "Wey/GÃ¼ey" (dude/man)
  - "Puta madre" (damn/holy shit - expression of amazement)
  - "QuÃ© verga" (what the hell/damn)
  - "Carnal" (brother/close friend)
  - "Morra/Viejas" (girls/women - slang)
  - "Chinga/Chingo" (a lot/tons)
  - "Mamadas/Pendejadas" (stupid things/bullshit)
  - "CabrÃ³n" (badass/tough guy)
  
- **Themes**: Self-reflection on past mistakes, personal growth, confidence, success with women, nicest boots
- **Corridos tumbados style** with traditional instrumentation
- **Storytelling narrative** typical of corridos genre
- Booming tuba, accordion, bajo sexto, regional Mexican sound
- Confident, humorous tone about transformation

**Sources:**
- [Luis R Conriquez Style](https://www.billboard.com/music/latin/luis-r-conriquez-corridos-belicos-kartel-music-interview-1235773837/)
- [Corridos Tumbados Genre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Corridos_tumbados)
- [Instrumentation Details](https://queonnda.com/en/instruments-defining-sound-of-corridos-tumbados/)

# /extract2 - High Quality Vocal Extraction

Studio-grade vocal extraction using BS-Roformer + MelBand Roformer. Maximum quality in ~6 minutes.

## Quick Usage

```
/extract2 https://youtu.be/VIDEO_ID
/extract2 https://youtu.be/VIDEO_ID "Artist - Song Title"
/extract2 ~/Music/song.mp3
/extract2 ~/Music/song.mp3 "Custom Name"
```

## Features

- â±ï¸  **Slower**: ~6 minutes for 3-4 min songs
- ðŸŽ¯ **Quality**: MAXIMUM (SDR 12.1-12.6 vocals, 16.3 instrumental)
- ðŸ’¾ **Output**: ~/Desktop/MediaVault_v2/separated_vocals_HQ/
- ðŸ¤– **Models**: BS-Roformer-Viperx-1296 + MelBand Roformer

## Instructions

Parse the arguments from: https://youtu.be/ZaLkFDiDdqE mp3

### Execute the Extraction

```bash
# Get the input and optional song name from arguments
~/.claude/skills/extract2.sh https://youtu.be/ZaLkFDiDdqE mp3
```

The script will:
1. Accept audio file or YouTube URL
2. Download if needed (YouTube)
3. Separate vocals using TWO state-of-the-art models
4. Save to MediaVault_v2/separated_vocals_HQ/

### Output Files

After completion, you'll find:
- [Song Name] - Vocals (BS-Roformer).wav - Best balanced
- [Song Name] - Vocals (MelBand).wav - Maximum clarity
- [Song Name] - Instrumental (BS-Roformer).wav
- [Song Name] - Original.wav
- info.txt (metadata)

### First Run Note

First run downloads ~1.3GB of AI models (one-time).

### When to Use

Use `/extract2` when:
- You need studio-grade quality
- Processing time is not a concern
- You're working on professional projects
- You want the best possible separation

For faster processing, use `/extract1` instead.
I'll execute the high-quality vocal extraction using the extract2 command.

content.text:
Perfect! Standard quality extraction complete using /extract1. Much faster - took only about 1 minute and 11 seconds compared to the 4+ minutes for /extract2.

## Extraction Summary

âœ… **Successfully extracted vocals using Demucs AI (standard quality):**

### Output Files Created:
1. **Standard Quality Extraction - Vocals.wav** - Clean vocals (SDR ~8.0)
2. **Standard Quality Extraction - Instrumental.wav** - Muffled instrumental (lo-fi effect applied)
3. **Standard Quality Extraction - Original.wav** - Original audio
4. **info.txt** - Metadata file

### File Location:
`~/Desktop/MediaVault_v2/separated_vocals/2026-01-15/Standard Quality Extraction/`

### Comparison:
- **/extract1**: ~1 min processing time, good quality (SDR ~8.0 vocals)
- **/extract2**: ~4.5 min processing time, maximum quality (SDR ~12.9 vocals)

The standard quality is perfect for most uses and significantly faster!
